name: CKEDITOR.ui.handlerDefinition
doc: Virtual class which just illustrates the features of handler objects to be passed to the CKEDITOR.ui.addHandler function. This class is not really part of the API, so don't call its constructor.

members.name: create
members.doc:
Transforms an item definition into an UI item object.

editorInstance.ui.addHandler( CKEDITOR.UI_BUTTON, {
    create: function( definition ) {
        return new CKEDITOR.ui.button( definition );
    }
} );

return.name: return
return.doc: The UI element. @todo We lack the "UI element" abstract super class.

members.short_doc: Transforms an item definition into an UI item object. ...
